dmv.spring.demo.model.repository.jdbc

Class JdbcConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • dmv.spring.demo.model.repository.jdbc.JdbcConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable

    public class JdbcConnector
extends Object
implements AutoCloseable
    Custom made manager for Connection and PreparedStatement, to be used in Repository classes. Reducing boilerplate code. The Connection is a pooled Connection from DataSourceUtils class

    SQLException will be converted to AccessDataBaseException at this level: opening and closing connections, setting parameters.

    It's not thread safe, and is expected to be created and then closed within a single method.

    It implements AutoCloseable interface and could be used with try-with-resources statement

    Author:
    dmv

    • Constructor Detail

      • JdbcConnector

        public JdbcConnector(DataSource dataSource,
                     NativeSQLQueries query)
        Creates Connection and PreparedStatement objects from given dataSource, using provided query.

        Don't forget to call close() method in the end.

        Parameters:
        dataSource - the DataSource to be used
        query - the NativeSQLQueries query
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - if open connection and prepare statement operations were not successful

    • Method Detail

      • close

        public void close()
        Close underlying statement and release connection
        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - if closing operations were not successful

      • getUpdateCount

        public int getUpdateCount()
        Returns the first update count after execution.

        This method won't get or cache any results (i.e. Result Sets are not expected). Use getResults() method instead if you need them.

        Returns:
        the first update count
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - translates SQLExceptions
        See Also:
        Statement.getUpdateCount()

      • getResults

        public List<ResultSet> getResults()
        Execute statement and return a list with ResultSet objects
        Returns:
        A list with available results (with RAM) or empty list if there were Update Counts only
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - translates SQLExceptions

      • getLong

        public long getLong(int resultIndex,
                    int columnIndex)
        Gets long from resultIndex ResultSet at columnIndex position
        Parameters:
        resultIndex - The results list index (java - 0 based)
        columnIndex - The column number (sql - 1 based)
        Returns:
        long result
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - translates SQLExceptions, and 'out of bound' errors will also fall into this category

      • getObject

        public <T> T getObject(int resultIndex,
                       org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowMapper<T> mapper)
        Retrieves an object from ResultSet found in a list of results at given index, using provided mapper
        Type Parameters:
        T - Entity type is expected (like Role or User)
        Parameters:
        resultIndex - list index (0 if expecting single result)
        mapper - the mapper to be used for objects creation
        Returns:
        a constructed object or null if none found
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - translates SQLExceptions, and 'out of bound' errors will also fall into this category

      • getObjects

        public <T> Set<T> getObjects(int resultIndex,
                             org.springframework.jdbc.core.RowMapper<T> mapper)
        Retrieves a set of objects from results list at given index, using provided mapper
        Type Parameters:
        T - Entity type is expected (like Role or User)
        Parameters:
        resultIndex - list index (0 if expecting single result)
        mapper - the mapper to be used for objects creation
        Returns:
        a set of constructed objects or empty set if none found
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - translates SQLExceptions, and 'out of bound' errors will also fall into this category

      • setLong

        public void setLong(int pos,
                    long num)
        Set Long number at specified position
        Parameters:
        pos - The position is SQL 1-based index
        num - a number to set
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - translates PreparedStatement.setLong(int, long) exception

      • setString

        public void setString(int pos,
                      String field)
        Set String that can be null or empty to current statement at given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position is SQL 1-based index
        field - the actual String to be set
        Throws:
        AccessDataBaseException - translates PreparedStatement.setString(int, String) exception

      • setRequiredString

        public void setRequiredString(int pos,
                              String field,
                              String fieldName)
        Set String which is required for current statement at given position.
        Parameters:
        pos - The position is SQL 1-based index
        field - the actual String to be set
        fieldName - field name (for logging and error messages)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if field is null or empty string
        AccessDataBaseException - translates PreparedStatement.setString(int, String) exception
